Title: James Bond Super Draft
Description:
**"James Bond Super Draft"** is a two-part super draft that collectively makes up the 156th episode of Screen Drafts , though the 157th episode ( Serial Killer ) aired between the two parts of this episode.

Unlike previous two-part episodes, this draft was conducted in separate sessions, with a week gap between the two drafts. The first episode drafted the bottom 13 movies, while the second episode selected the top 13. While both Non-Eon films Never Say Never Again and Casino Royale were eligible, only one could make the final list. Guest G.M.s Dave Schilling, Piya Sinha-Roy, Bryan Cogman, Phil Nobile Jr. and Drew McWeeny  ranked the entire James Bond franchise. McWeeny took over for Nobile Jr. in episode two, and earned a bonus veto from the vote on Patreon.

Title: Martin Scorsese Super Draft
Description:
**"Martin Scorsese Super Draft"** is the 264th episode of Screen Drafts . Across three parts, nine drafters ranked the 29 theatrical releases directed by Martin Scorsese, along with No Direction Home , which advanced from a special Patreon episode to the main draft.

In part one, Kenny Neibart, Phil Iscove and Emily St. James ranked the 30th through 21st films in Scorsese's filmography.

In part two Joe Reid, Katey Rich and Chris Feil ranked the 20th through 11th films from the remaining 20 titles, while Phil Iscove served as Guest Co-Commissioner.

In part three, Oriana Nudo, Bryan Cogman and Roxana Hadadi placed the remaining ten films. The episode is notable for having multiple veto overrides, the first over override of a veto awarded to the Patreon Members, and for the largest jump from a movie vetoed higher up the list, with The Age of Innocence jumping from No. 29 to No. 1 on the list.

Guest G.M.s Drew McWeeny and Alan Sepinwall selected the seven best movies that served as continuations of a television series. This is a sequel draft to TV Adaptations . This episode also featured the first main feed announcement of the Cool Kids Criterion Club series.

Title: Twist Endings
Description:
**"Twist Endings"** is the 15th episode of Screen Drafts. Drafters Graham Skipper and Sean Keller selected the seven best movies that featured twist endings.

This episode saw The Wicker Man become the first film to enter the Marquee of Fame, having previously been selected (also at No. 1) in the Christopher Lee draft.

The events of this episode also led to the creation of the Commissioner Override, due to Skipper playing a movie that does not contain a twist ending, but having no method for removing the film from the list.
